p: No known locations of upland species or southwestern species are predicted to remain environmentally suitable in the face of predicted climate change ( Table 6). Several locations across a restricted part of the south-east coast of East Falkland are predicted to be suitable for P. moorei, however no populations currently occur in this area. For Nastanthus falklandicus 46% of currently known sites are predicted to remain environmentally suitable in the long term ( Table 6).
